articles.title: Machine Learning vs. Deep Learning: What's the Difference?
articles.description: Artificial intelligence technology is undergirded by two intertwined forms of automation.
articles.content: Artificial intelligence is everywhere these days, but the fundamentals of how this influential new technology works can be confusing. Two of the most important fields in AI development are “machine learning” and its sub-field, “deep learning.” Here’s... [6776 chars]

articles.title: Scalable AI-Driven 3D Model Reconstruction from Smartphone Images for Industry 4.0
articles.description: Researchers from Wideverse and SisInfLab at Politecnico di Bari developed a scalable cloud-native pipeline for 3D model reconstruction using smartphone images, leveraging AI and machine learning for efficient and customizable models. The system integrates low-end hardware with high-end cloud resources, enhancing industrial applications like Digital Twins and augmented reality.
articles.content: Researchers from Wideverse and SisInfLab at Politecnico di Bari have developed a novel cloud-native pipeline to efficiently reconstruct 3D models using 2D images captured by smartphone cameras. The project addresses the growing need for scalable and ... [6180 chars]

articles.title: Nobel Prize in physics spotlights key breakthroughs in AI revolution − making machines that learn
articles.description: The Nobel Prize shows that the field of artificial neural networks – and the deep learning AI revolution the technology unleashed – owe as much to physics as biology and computer science.
articles.content: If your jaw dropped as you watched the latest AI-generated video, your bank balance was saved from criminals by a fraud detection system, or your day was made a little easier because you were able to dictate a text message on the run, you have many s... [6475 chars]

articles.title: Redefining human-centered design: AI and EEG for emotion-sensitive architecture
articles.description: The AI model employs a hybrid deep learning approach combining convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and long short-term memory (LSTM) architectures. CNNs extract spatial features from EEG data, while LSTMs capture temporal dependencies, enabling precise emotion classification.
articles.content: Artificial intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing various fields, from healthcare and neuroscience to smart cities and human-centered design. In the realm of architecture, AI is now paving the way for intelligent spaces that dynamically respond to huma... [6496 chars]

articles.title: How Nobel Laureates’ Work On AI, Machine Learning Define Modern Internet, Why They Warn Of ‘Consequences’
articles.description: Hopfield used ideas from physics to study a particular type of recurrent neural network, now called the Hopfield network. Hinton extended Hopfield’s ideas to create a new class of models called Boltzmann machines
articles.content: It wouldn’t be wrong to say that Artificial Intelligence (AI) has taken over the world. Today, from videos to fraud detection system, dictating a text while doing your other chores, all seem seamless. Thanks to the scientists, mathematicians and engi... [5148 chars]
